overloads.description:
Constructs a freed [[graphics_environment]].
See [[freeable]] for more information.

exceptions: Throws std::runtime_error if there was an error during setup due to causes outside of the program.
warnings: It is undefined behaviour to construct or destruct a [[graphics_environment]] on a thread other than the one that started the program.

items.briefDescription: Returns whether the given thread is the main graphics thread.
detailedDescription: Returns whether the given thread is the main graphics thread.
items.name: is_main_thread

items.briefDescription: Returns whether the thread calling this is the main graphics thread.
detailedDescription: Returns whether the thread calling this is the main graphics thread.
items.name: is_this_main_thread

exceptions: Throws any exception thrown by code handling the jobs.
items.briefDescription: Handles any jobs from outside the program, like keyboard inputs.
detailedDescription: Handles any jobs from outside the program, which has been received since the last call to [[graphics_environment::update]].
Jobs include for example reacting to inputs from a keyboard or mouse.
items.name: update

warnings: It is undefined behaviour to construct or destruct a [[graphics_environment]] on a thread other than the one that started the program.
briefDescription: Sets up gpu-logic which is required by most other logic in [[CompWolf.Graphics.Core]]
detailedDescription: Sets up gpu-logic which is required by most other logic in [[CompWolf.Graphics.Core]]
The thread this was constructed on is considered the main graphics thread.
name: graphics_environment
